About.name: Bristol, UWE
About.about:
Choose to do university right
At UWE Bristol, we empower our students to make a choice. To choose a university that pushes itself as much as it pushes you. To choose a community that’s breaking boundaries and leading the way. To choose a passion that excites, delights and gives you purpose.
Excellent employability
90% of our graduates are in work or further study 15 months after graduation, placing UWE Bristol in the top 50 UK universities for positive graduate employment prospects (Graduate Outcome Survey results from 2021/22, published 2024).
Support services
We know that heading to university is a big deal. It’s our aim as a university to give you all the tools you need to succeed. Services and resources available include academic personal tutors, School support staff, Peer Assisted Learning (student-to-student support scheme), student support advisers and a 24/7 wellbeing service.
About.whatMakesUsDifferent:
Everything we do here is focused on preparing you for the real world. Our strong links with national and international employers allow us to design industry-relevant courses and offer hands-on placements and internships.
There’s much more to the UWE Bristol experience than just our courses. Music, sports, community projects, support networks, the list goes on. With over 160 societies and clubs to choose from, students are sure to find something great to get involved with, meet new people, and have fun.
One of our best assets is our city. Bristol is famous for its independent thinking, unique urban style and culture of innovative creativity. It’s not just a great place to live, with its music, arts, culture, green spaces, food scene and fantastic festivals. It’s a great place to start a career too, in a hotbed of creativity, innovation, research and tech. This variety of benefits makes Bristol a city buzzing with potential and whatever students are into, they’ll find it here.

Stats.heading: Stats
Stats.description: Statistics and reviews are supplied by trusted partners and are independent to UCAS. You should also consider attending an open day and talking to staff and students.

StudentLife.heading: Student life
studentLifeParagraphs: Clubs & Societies: UWE Bristol has over 40 sports clubs, including team and individual sports, ranging from netball and football to sub-aqua and gliding. Get involved to represent UWE Bristol, socialise with like-minded people and make new friends.

Accommodation: We want you to feel at home from day one, and that’s why we have a range of accommodation on offer, both on and off campus. With 900 new student rooms on our main campus, we’re sure you’ll find something that’s right for you.

SU: The Students’ Union is the heart of UWE Bristol’s student community, democratically elected to ensure the student voice is heard at every level of the institution. It’s also the University’s social hub, with a great selection of bars, clubs and restaurants.

City life: One of the world’s top 50 cities (Time Out, 2025). Best place to visit in the UK (Time Out, 2024). Bristol is a firm student favourite and it’s harder to think of a better city in the UK to study, live and work in.

regionGuides.heading: What's it like to live in South West?Check out our region guide
paragraphs: The South West of England is made up of seven counties, with rural areas surrounding key student cities – from Plymouth and Bournemouth up to Bath, Bristol and Cheltenham & Gloucester.

You'll find many a festival – including the world-famous Glastonbury. And if you're a cider or cheese buff, you'll have plenty to try in the South West. You can always walk it off in Dartmoor and Exmoor national parks, or beautiful countryside from the Cotswolds to Land's End.
Cornwall, Dorset, and Devon are big coastal favourites, with idyllic beaches and waves to test the bravest surfers.

regionGuides.heading: What's it like to live in Bristol?Check out our city guide
paragraphs: Discover what it’s really like to live in Bristol as an international student, from the vibrant arts scene to the student-friendly atmosphere.

campusParagraphs: Spread over three campuses, all just a short journey from one another, each site offers something unique. In recent years, we've invested £300 million into our industry-standard facilities. Creating the most effective and empowering setting for our students and people to discover their potential.

Courses.heading: Courses
paragraphs: We offer over 200 practice-based undergraduate courses covering a vast range of subjects, of which nearly 170 are accredited. We work closely with over 16,000 national and international employer partners to make sure our courses are up-to-the-minute, industry-relevant, and meet the required professional standards.

UWE Bristol’s teaching is enriched by the University’s modern facilities and firm industry connections, with courses designed with your career in mind. There are also opportunities for real-world experience alongside theoretical learning, with many courses offering work placements and internships while studying. This blend will give you an all-important head-start, equipping you with desirable skills and the kind of mindset that employers are looking for.
There are also opportunities to develop your enterprising skills, fostering leadership, innovation and commercial awareness, as well as problem solving, decision making and planning.

Apprenticeships.heading: Apprenticeships
paragraphs: Many apprenticeships offer the opportunity to gain a higher education qualification – usually a Bachelor's or Master's depending on your chosen course – and on most apprenticeships you’ll earn a salary while  doing it.
Benefits of becoming an apprentice

International.heading: International
paragraphs: UWE Bristol is a University Alliance university with a common mission to make the difference to our cities and regions. We use our experience of providing high quality teaching and research with real world impact to shape higher education and research policy for the benefit of our students and business and civic partners. We innovate together, learn from each other and support every member to transform lives and deliver growth.
Our teaching

With more than 600 courses on offer, at undergraduate, postgraduate, professional and short course level, we offer a broad range of subjects. These range from the arts, creative industries, health, science, business, law, environment and technology disciplines. We’re well known for the quality of our teaching, and for our holistic student experience.

We’ve built close links with leading employers such as CERN, Rolls Royce, the NHS, Aardman Animation and the BBC. This ensures we develop your course with the right content and give you exposure to diverse professional opportunities.
"We want our students to become ready and able graduates, who feel confident in their abilities and the part they have to play in the world." Professor Steve West, Vice-Chancellor
Our Campuses
Our 10 different Schools are spread across three campuses in and around Bristol.

We have invested in the latest facilities and resources to give you access to everything you need to succeed – with £300m being spent on new industry-standard learning spaces and modern accommodation.
Our research and wider impact

Alongside our teaching, our academics are working on nationally and internationally-renowned research in many interesting areas – from robotics to appearance issues. As well as enriching our teaching, we ensure our research contributes to society and the economy through knowledge exchange, science communication, partnerships and supporting business innovation and growth.
We also play an active role in our city and wider region, and are seen by many employers and organisations as the "go-to university" for graduate recruitment.
Our Location

Bristol is a big pull for students and employers alike. One of the UK’s most diverse and desirable cities to study and live in, it’s also a city that’s buzzing with industry – with interesting networks, opportunities and graduate employment options right here on our doorstep.
